productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 84 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Powered by Intel Arc Let’s Play Unlock your next gaming adventure with Intel Arc graphics, powered by all-new XeHPG microarchitecture, delivering scalable performance.With a wide range of hardware and software optimizations, from advanced Xe-cores, to AI-enhanced XeSS upscaling technology, to robust Game On drivers, jump into a new world of gaming with Intel Arc graphics.Full support for DirectX 12 Ultimate enables exceptional visual experiences in vivid virtual worlds.Xe HPG microarchitecture features advanced ray tracing units to elevate gaming experiences with realistic lighting, shadows, and reflections. Let’s Create Unleash your imagination and captivate audiences with rich digital content creation using a hyper advanced media engine, augmented by AI and accelerated by Intel Deep Link technology.Create compelling content, powered by a graphics card with support for all current leading media formats, and get equipped for the future with AV1 video encode capabilities.Whether you edit photos and videos or create in 3D, Intel Arc graphics is the ultimate choice in performance for digital creation. Let’s Stream Broadcast and stream from any space with advanced streaming technologies enabling flexibility and creative control.Intel Arc graphics delivers a fully featured streaming experience with performance accelerating Intel Deep Link technology, enhanced stream quality, a convenient virtual camera, and automatically generated highlights.A high performance, seamless end-to end streaming experience is just one click away.

Features ThermalSync By the patented(pending) heatsink design and an extra thermal sensor, SPARKLE Intel Arc TITAN / ORC series is able to change the color of LED lightbar according to GPU temperature without installing any driver. TORN Cooling The TORN cooling solution features a customized AXL Fan, which delivers superior airflow for optimal cooling. The fan blades are designed with stripe structures and polished surfaces on the bottom side, enhancing their cooling performance even further. 0dB Fan Mode 0dB fan mode allows fans stop spinning when GPU temperature lower than target, provide ultra silence experience when your system in a light loading. AV1 Encoder The world’s first VGA support AV1 encode delivered the powerful media acceleration and DP2.0 x3 and HDMI 2.0 x1 support the new generation of 8K video output, providing an ultimate creation experience. Support for Every Major Codec H.264/AVCVP9H.265/HEVCAV1

Free Graphics Card Holder for SPARKLE TITAN Series While supply lasts, SPARKLE includes a limited VGA holder in the box for each TITAN Series Graphics Card to keep the perfect positioning of your VGA. Take advantage of this exclusive opportunity to let SPARKLE support your system setup.

Key Spec GPU Architecture Alchemist Xe Cores / XMX Engines 32 / 512 Render Slices 8 Ray Tracing Units 32 Graphics Clock 2300 MHz Memory Config 16GB GDDR6 @ 17.5Gbps Memory Interface 256-bit Memory Bandwidth 560 GB/s System Interface PCIe Gen 4.0 x 16 Power (TDP) 225W Video Output 1x HDMI 2.0, 3x DisplayPort 2.0 Dimension 305.5 x 103.4 x 2.5 Slot Power Requirement 650W or greater PSU Power Connector 2x 8-pin PCIe Connector

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing value and performance
reviews.reviewText: I paired this GPU with I5 13400f it absolutely delivers with game performance and value . Honestly I was on a 1400 dollar budget build and this worked flawlessly. I think the think ppl overlook is having to tweak games settings for best appearance and fps .I was looking for GPU around Xmas time which is a terrible ideas fyi . This thingnis absolutely a beast for the money .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome for Video Encoding!
reviews.reviewText: Preface: I am using this for video encoding, not gaming.I definitely recommend this card if you do any video encoding tasks. It seems really solid/well-built for what many would consider a 'low-end' card.This Sparkle ARC A310 4GB paired with an older i7-8700K is performing better than expected and runs much cooler/quieter than my previous card(quadro).A quick test encoding a 60-minute 1080p60 movie give the following averages in Handbrake:-450fps with AV1 10-bit at 'fastest' encoder quality setting, 20-30% CPU-226fps with AV1 10-bit at 'slowest' encoder quality setting, 20-30% CPU-450fps with H265/HEVC 10-bit at 'fastest' encoder quality setting, 20-30% CPU-220fps with H265/HEVC 10-bit at 'slowest' encoder quality setting, 20-30% CPU

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good Card
reviews.reviewText: This card is really good, for that price I really think you can not get anything better than this, BUT be careful with heat, this thing gets really hot, not a problem if you have a good set of fans to take the heat out, if you dont, games will probably freeze te prevent the card to get damage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sparkle arc a770 o.c. titan is better than an rtx 3090 at converting a 4K 2d video to 3d sbs
reviews.reviewText: Ok i know this sounds like an exaggeration but this is the god to honest truth, i bought the sparkle a770 o.c. 16gb edition specifically for converting 2d 4k video into 4k 3d full sbs video. I own an rtx 3070 by nvidia and an rtx 3090. And when it comes to video editing in davinci resolve, the arc a770 by sparkles not only is blazing fast but it absolutely murders the rtx 3070 at rendering 4k in davinci resolve. When i used to deflicker a 4k 3d depth map with my rtx 3070, it would take 17 hours to run a deflicker filter on my 3d depth maps. Well on the arc a770, it takes me only 4 hours and 49 minutes.My rtx 3090 would take 5 and a half hours to deflicker a depth map in davinci. So the arc is 30 minutes faster at deflickering a two hour 3d depth map video than my rtx 3090. I don't know what intel has done but their drivers have vastly improved for video rendering. Now when i want to combine a depth map with a 2d video to make a 3d video, my rrx 3090 would take 26 to 30 hours to render a 4k 3d two hour video. With my arc a770 by sparkle it takes only 18 hours. So in that specific task it is 8 to 12 hours faster at rendering a 4k 3d video. This puts it on par with a 4080 for video rendering specifically when it comes to editing 3d video in a software called 3d combine. Im so impressed im gonna sell my 3090 , because why would i keep my 3090 when it cost more and my arc is faster. Now im a video editor so i can only speak for video editing, that this card is better at video editing in some instances of 4k than an nvidia card, but i can't speak about the gaming aspect because i did not buy this card to game, i did hear that this card is slower at gaming, but if you are a content creator, and u dont game, this is a better card, it has improved my conversion times at lot on video renders, the reviews on YouTube are outdated and all the reviews are mainly about gaming, so im speaking from the standpoint of people who are looking for a card for video editing and rendering, this is the card to go to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice upgrade at a good price
reviews.reviewText: Still running benchmarks using 3D Mark, but this GPU is meeting and exceeding my expectations.I'm in the process of building a gaming system on a very tight budget and I'm getting a great bang for my buck.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Annoying fan, worthless performance
reviews.reviewText: My older AMD Ryzen 7 5800H laptop feels snappier in some applications than my I9-13900K build, although the latter on paper has superior components in everything except the graphics card. I don't play games, so I upgraded to the Arc 380 to improve the "2D" experience. However, the 2D results with the Arc 380 in Performancetest turned out almost equal to the built in graphics, while the laptop has about 30 % better result. So far the Arc 380 has been wasted money and electricity. The worst part is the fan. It turns on and off a few seconds maybe every minute or so, even when it's under no load. The OLD intel Arc drivers offers control over the fan curve, so fine. But the NEW drivers has removed the fan control. I might just rip the stupid thing out of the cabinet and continue with the built in graphics. When I installed the drivers the first time the computer crashed, and the computer seems generally a little less stable. Some annoying notifications from Intel appear every time the computer restarts. Maybe Intel should stick to making processors and let others make the software. I don't game, but a few games was included with the card. I could install them even if the promo period was over. In Steam I found a few games my son played maybe 12 years ago. I installed Portal and tried it for a few minutes. I might have had a framerate of maybe 3 FPS. I gave up quickly without trying to fine tune the settings. If the card struggles with 12 year old games, I don't thing it would stand a chance with new games.
